body:
@casualjim Would you be interested in this PR?
I belive this is more of a bug fix than an enhancement as the generated documentation describes that the server should shutdown after a call to `Server.Shutdown()` but it does not?

My own feeling is that all contributions are welcome.
You should not worry that much about bug vs enhancement distinction in issues.
It is more an indication on how to priorize things.
Since the toolkit has many use cases it is often difficult to judge priority from a single userr's perspective.

Generally speaking if you feel it is important, post a PR.

The reason I'm asking is to prioritise my time as well. We are using this in production now and would like to know if a PR is likely to be released any time soon.

Any how, I'll prepare a PR. Any checklists or alike I should use? I had some difficulty running the different make targets locally. Is it fine to just make the changes in the templates and sources and let example generation etc. be handled when things are to be merged?
yes I think this is a valuable contribution. I have to see exactly where the changes will be made and at worst I'd ask to rename a method or something.
if you can run `go test ./...` we should be good
Great. I'll prepare the PR. Thank you for the quick answers.

issue.title: Add shutdown handling of graceful server on calls to Server.Shutdown
issue.body:
Fixes #1316 (https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/issues/1316)

This change implements proper shutdown handling when calling `Server.Shutdown`. On calls to the method the graceful server is signalled to shutdown and the method blocks until shutdown have completed.

issue.title: Deadlock issue in shutdown function under restapi
issue.body:
## Problem statement
I have a issue when I do the test under restapi and when I try to shutdown the sever during the compile. The deadlock happened. I have checked the code under https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/blob/master/examples/tutorials/custom-server/gen/restapi/server.go and found that there is no buffer for the channel when the shutdown was defined under NewServer. The buffer may need to be added under NewServer function. The code in the code base now is 
```go
func NewServer(api *operations.GreeterAPI) *Server {
	s := new(Server)

	s.shutdown = make(chan struct{})
	s.api = api
	return s
}
```
## Swagger specification
The code under go-swagger/generator/templates/server/server.gotmpl may need to be updated.
```go
// NewServer creates a new api {{ humanize .Name }} server but does not configure it
func NewServer(api *{{ .Package }}.{{ pascalize .Name }}API) *Server {
	s := new(Server)
  {{ if .UsePFlags }}
        s.EnabledListeners = enabledListeners
	s.CleanupTimeout = cleanupTimout
	s.MaxHeaderSize = maxHeaderSize
	s.SocketPath = socketPath
	s.Host = stringEnvOverride(host, "", "HOST")
	s.Port = intEnvOverride(port, 0, "PORT")
	s.ListenLimit = listenLimit
	s.KeepAlive = keepAlive
	s.ReadTimeout = readTimeout
	s.WriteTimeout = writeTimeout
	s.TLSHost = stringEnvOverride(tlsHost, s.Host, "TLS_HOST", "HOST")
	s.TLSPort = intEnvOverride(tlsPort, 0, "TLS_PORT")
	s.TLSCertificate = stringEnvOverride(tlsCertificate, "", "TLS_CERTIFICATE")
	s.TLSCertificateKey = stringEnvOverride(tlsCertificateKey, "", "TLS_PRIVATE_KEY")
        s.TLSCACertificate = stringEnvOverride(tlsCACertificate, "", "TLS_CA_CERTIFICATE")
	s.TLSListenLimit = tlsListenLimit
	s.TLSKeepAlive = tlsKeepAlive
	s.TLSReadTimeout = tlsReadTimeout
	s.TLSWriteTimeout = tlsWriteTimeout{{ if .ExcludeSpec }}
        s.Spec = specFile
  {{ end }}{{ end }}
	s.shutdown = make(chan struct{})
	s.api = api
	return s
}
```
## Steps to reproduce
Below is a portion of code under my test file in the restapi
```go
        api := operations.NewSwaggerCcmtsAPI(swaggerSpec)
        server := NewServer(api)
        defer server.Shutdown()
        server.ConfigureFlags()
        server.ConfigureAPI()
        handler := server.GetHandler()
```
Then I initialize the tests for restapi. When I run the test, there is always deadlock happened. 

## Environment
swagger version: 0.14.0
go version: 1.10.2
OS: linux/amd64

issue.title: fix: Shutdown method didn't shutdown all the schemes
issue.body:
Original Issue: #1316 

When there are more than one schemes configured for the server (e.g. both http and https), there are multiple server instances listen for the shutdown message. So sending only one message 
```s.shutdown <- struct{}{}``` is not enough to close all of them. Instead, we can close the channel
```close(s.shutdown)```. Then all the instances that waiting to read from it can return all at once.
